title: India unveils new river-link roadmap to secure water for drought-prone regions
content: The Union government has presented a phased river-link strategy focused on improving irrigation and drinking water access in vulnerable districts. Officials said the first stage will prioritize inter-state agreements, environmental safeguards, and community-led monitoring. Policy analysts say the plan could reduce water stress if projects remain transparent and scientifically validated.

title: AI labs in Bengaluru launch multilingual model tuned for Indian public services
content: A consortium of startups and academic researchers has released a multilingual AI model designed for grievance portals, healthcare triage, and citizen support in regional languages. Developers claim the model improves accuracy on low-resource dialects and includes bias evaluation checkpoints. Industry observers call it a significant step in building sovereign AI infrastructure.

title: Global climate summit reaches breakthrough on coastal resilience financing
content: Delegations at the global climate summit have agreed to a financing framework aimed at supporting coastal defenses in vulnerable nations. The package includes blended funding and a rapid disbursal mechanism for extreme weather emergencies. Experts warn implementation speed will determine whether the framework translates into measurable adaptation outcomes.

title: Indian startup corridor sees record seed funding in deep-tech and mobility
content: Early-stage investors poured fresh capital into deep-tech, EV supply chain, and logistics software startups this quarter. Founders say improved prototype grants and faster compliance workflows have boosted investor confidence. Analysts note that disciplined burn rates and export-oriented product strategy remain central to long-term sustainability.

title: India and Southeast Asia expand digital trade corridor with secure payment rails
content: Trade ministries announced a digital trade corridor to simplify customs workflows and enable low-friction cross-border payments for SMEs. The initiative includes standards for invoice authentication and fraud monitoring. Economists say the corridor could unlock significant gains for services exports and regional digital commerce.

title: New chip design startup from Hyderabad targets efficient AI inference for edge devices
content: A Hyderabad-based semiconductor startup has introduced an edge AI chip architecture optimized for low power and real-time inference. The company says pilot deployments in manufacturing and smart mobility are underway with local partners.
